<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: private void buildDataPart(DataOutputStream dataOutputStream, String parameterName, String parameterValue) throws IOException {
dataOutputStream.writeBytes(twoHyphens + boundary + lineEnd);
dataOutputStream.writeBytes("Content-Disposition: form-data; name=" + parameterName);
dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);
dataOutputStream.writeBytes(parameterValue);
dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);
}

<<<explanation>>>: To convert your data quickly to a byte format and back to its original form, you can use the DataOutputStream.write method. This method allows you to write data to a stream in a binary format, which can be more efficient than converting to a string and then back to the original data type.

In your case, you can create a DataOutputStream and use its write method to write your data as bytes. For example, to convert an INT data type, you can create an Integer object, get its value as bytes using the getBytes method, and then write those bytes to the DataOutputStream. Similarly, for a DOUBLE data type, you can create a Double object and get its value as bytes using the getBytes method.

To convert a String data type, you can use the getBytes method to get the bytes representation of the string and then write those bytes to the DataOutputStream.

Here's an example of how you can use the DataOutputStream.write method to convert an Integer data type:
```kotlin
int number = 123;
DataOutputStream dataOutputStream = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream("data.bin"));
dataOutputStream.writeInt(number);
dataOutputStream.close();
```
You can use a similar approach to convert other data types. Once you have the data as bytes, you can read it back into the original data type using the DataInputStream.read method.

In terms of external libraries, using the DataOutputStream and DataInputStream methods is a built-in solution that doesn't require any external dependencies. However, if you need more advanced features or better performance, you may want to consider using a library like Gson or JsonParser, which can parse and generate JSON data, which is a common data interchange format.
